trans-unit.source: Add apps for enrolled devices | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Add apps for enrolled devices | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Before you can deploy an app, you must add it to Intune.
trans-unit.target: Before you can deploy an app, you must add it to Intune.

trans-unit.source: Then it’s available in the Intune console, where you can deploy and manage it.
trans-unit.target: Then it’s available in the Intune console, where you can deploy and manage it.

trans-unit.source: Add apps for enrolled devices to Intune
trans-unit.target: Add apps for enrolled devices to Intune

trans-unit.source: Before you can deploy or manage an app, you must add it to Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Before you can deploy or manage an app, you must add it to Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to add apps for enrolled devices.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to add apps for enrolled devices.

trans-unit.source: The information in this topic helps you add apps that you want to deploy to enrolled devices and enrolled Windows PCs.
trans-unit.target: The information in this topic helps you add apps that you want to deploy to enrolled devices and enrolled Windows PCs.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add apps for Windows PCs that you manage by using the Intune client software, see [Add apps for Windows PCs in Microsoft Intune](add-apps-for-windows-pcs-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to add apps for Windows PCs that you manage by using the Intune client software, see [Add apps for Windows PCs in Microsoft Intune](add-apps-for-windows-pcs-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Add the app
trans-unit.target: Add the app

trans-unit.source: You use the Intune Software Publisher to configure the properties of the app and, where applicable, upload it to your cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: You use the Intune Software Publisher to configure the properties of the app and, where applicable, upload it to your cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administrator console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Apps** > **Add Apps** to start the Intune Software Publisher.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administrator console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Apps** > **Add Apps** to start the Intune Software Publisher.

trans-unit.source: You might need to enter your Intune user name and password before the publisher starts.
trans-unit.target: You might need to enter your Intune user name and password before the publisher starts.

trans-unit.source: On the **Software setup** page of the publisher, choose one of the following options for **Select how this software is made available to devices**:
trans-unit.target: On the **Software setup** page of the publisher, choose one of the following options for **Select how this software is made available to devices**:

trans-unit.source: **Software installer**, for apps with the extension **.msi** or **.exe**:
trans-unit.target: **Software installer**, for apps with the extension **.msi** or **.exe**:

trans-unit.source: **Select the software installer file type**.
trans-unit.target: **Select the software installer file type**.

trans-unit.source: This indicates the type of software that you want to deploy.
trans-unit.target: This indicates the type of software that you want to deploy.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to install an iOS app, choose **App Package for iOS (*.ipa file)**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to install an iOS app, choose **App Package for iOS (*.ipa file)**.

trans-unit.source: **Specify the location of the software setup files**.
trans-unit.target: **Specify the location of the software setup files**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the location of the installation files, or choose **Browse** to select the location from a list.
trans-unit.target: Enter the location of the installation files, or choose **Browse** to select the location from a list.

trans-unit.source: **Include additional files and subfolders from the same folder**.
trans-unit.target: **Include additional files and subfolders from the same folder**.

trans-unit.source: This option is for the **Windows Installer** file type only.
trans-unit.target: This option is for the **Windows Installer** file type only.

trans-unit.source: Some software that uses Windows Installer requires supporting files that are typically found in the same folder as the installation files.
trans-unit.target: Some software that uses Windows Installer requires supporting files that are typically found in the same folder as the installation files.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you also want to deploy these files.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you also want to deploy these files.

trans-unit.source: This installation type uses some of your cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: This installation type uses some of your cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: **External link**, for apps that you want to create by specifying a link to an app store:
trans-unit.target: **External link**, for apps that you want to create by specifying a link to an app store:

trans-unit.source: **Specify the URL**.
trans-unit.target: **Specify the URL**.

trans-unit.source: Specify the URL of one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Specify the URL of one of the following:

trans-unit.source: The app store URL of the app that you want to deploy.
trans-unit.target: The app store URL of the app that you want to deploy.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to deploy the Microsoft Remote Desktop app for Android, specify **https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.rdc.android**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to deploy the Microsoft Remote Desktop app for Android, specify **https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.rdc.android**.

trans-unit.source: To find the URL of the app, use a search engine to find the store page that contains the app.
trans-unit.target: To find the URL of the app, use a search engine to find the store page that contains the app.

trans-unit.source: For example, to find the Remote Desktop app, you can search for **Microsoft Remote Desktop Android**.
trans-unit.target: For example, to find the Remote Desktop app, you can search for **Microsoft Remote Desktop Android**.

trans-unit.source: A website.
trans-unit.target: A website.

trans-unit.source: Intune will deploy a shortcut icon to the site on the device (known as a web clip).
trans-unit.target: Intune will deploy a shortcut icon to the site on the device (known as a web clip).

trans-unit.source: An app on the web.
trans-unit.target: An app on the web.

trans-unit.source: Intune will deploy a shortcut icon to the app on the device.
trans-unit.target: Intune will deploy a shortcut icon to the app on the device.

trans-unit.source: **Require a managed browser to open this link (Android and iOS only)**.
trans-unit.target: **Require a managed browser to open this link (Android and iOS only)**.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a link to a website or web app to users, they will be able to open it only in the Intune managed browser.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a link to a website or web app to users, they will be able to open it only in the Intune managed browser.

trans-unit.source: This browser must be installed on their device.
trans-unit.target: This browser must be installed on their device.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the managed browser, see [Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune](manage-internet-access-using-managed-browser-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the managed browser, see [Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune](manage-internet-access-using-managed-browser-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: This installation type does not use any of your cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: This installation type does not use any of your cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: **Managed iOS app from the app store**, for free apps from the iTunes store that you want to manage with mobile application management (MAM) policies:
trans-unit.target: **Managed iOS app from the app store**, for free apps from the iTunes store that you want to manage with mobile application management (MAM) policies:

trans-unit.source: **Specify the URL**.
trans-unit.target: **Specify the URL**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the app store URL of the app that you want to deploy.
trans-unit.target: Enter the app store URL of the app that you want to deploy.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to deploy the Microsoft Work Folders app for iOS, specify **https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/work-folders/id950878067?mt=8**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to deploy the Microsoft Work Folders app for iOS, specify **https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/work-folders/id950878067?mt=8**.

trans-unit.source: This installation type does not use any of your cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: This installation type does not use any of your cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to deploy the Microsoft Word app from the iTunes store to devices, the page would look like this:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to deploy the Microsoft Word app from the iTunes store to devices, the page would look like this:

trans-unit.source: Intune Software Publisher
trans-unit.target: Intune Software Publisher

trans-unit.source: On the **Software description** page, configure the following:
trans-unit.target: On the **Software description** page, configure the following:

trans-unit.source: Depending on the installer type that you are using, some of these values might have been automatically entered.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the installer type that you are using, some of these values might have been automatically entered.

trans-unit.source: **Publisher**.
trans-unit.target: **Publisher**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the publisher of the app.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the publisher of the app.

trans-unit.source: **Name**.
trans-unit.target: **Name**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the app as it will be displayed in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the app as it will be displayed in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: Make sure all app names that you use are unique.
trans-unit.target: Make sure all app names that you use are unique.

trans-unit.source: If the same app name exists twice, only one of the apps will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: If the same app name exists twice, only one of the apps will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Description**.
trans-unit.target: **Description**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a description for the app.
trans-unit.target: Enter a description for the app.

trans-unit.source: This will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: This will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **URL for software information**.
trans-unit.target: **URL for software information**.

trans-unit.source: This is available only if you selected **Software installer**.
trans-unit.target: This is available only if you selected **Software installer**.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, enter the URL of a website that contains information about this app.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, enter the URL of a website that contains information about this app.

trans-unit.source: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Privacy URL**.
trans-unit.target: **Privacy URL**.

trans-unit.source: This is available only if you selected **Software installer**.
trans-unit.target: This is available only if you selected **Software installer**.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, enter the URL of a website that contains privacy information for this app.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, enter the URL of a website that contains privacy information for this app.

trans-unit.source: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Category** (optional).
trans-unit.target: **Category** (optional).

trans-unit.source: Select one of the built-in app categories.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the built-in app categories.

trans-unit.source: This will make it easier for users to find the app when they browse the company portal.
trans-unit.target: This will make it easier for users to find the app when they browse the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Display this as a featured app and highlight it in the company portal**.
trans-unit.target: **Display this as a featured app and highlight it in the company portal**.

trans-unit.source: Display the app prominently on the main page of the company portal when users browse for apps.
trans-unit.target: Display the app prominently on the main page of the company portal when users browse for apps.

trans-unit.source: **Icon** (optional).
trans-unit.target: **Icon** (optional).

trans-unit.source: Upload an icon that will be associated with the app.
trans-unit.target: Upload an icon that will be associated with the app.

trans-unit.source: This is the icon that will be displayed with the app when users browse the company portal.
trans-unit.target: This is the icon that will be displayed with the app when users browse the company portal.

trans-unit.source: In this example, you configured a description for the Microsoft Word app for iOS:
trans-unit.target: In this example, you configured a description for the Microsoft Word app for iOS:

trans-unit.source: Software description example
trans-unit.target: Software description example

trans-unit.source: On the **Requirements** page, select the requirements that must be met before the app can be installed on a device.
trans-unit.target: On the **Requirements** page, select the requirements that must be met before the app can be installed on a device.

trans-unit.source: For example, for an app package for iOS, you can select the minimum version of iOS required.
trans-unit.target: For example, for an app package for iOS, you can select the minimum version of iOS required.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can select the type of device that it must be, like an iPhone or an iPad.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can select the type of device that it must be, like an iPhone or an iPad.

trans-unit.source: The **Requirements** page is not displayed for all types of apps.
trans-unit.target: The **Requirements** page is not displayed for all types of apps.

trans-unit.source: Further wizard pages are displayed when you choose the **Windows Installer** file type.
trans-unit.target: Further wizard pages are displayed when you choose the **Windows Installer** file type.

trans-unit.source: This file type is used when you deploy software to PCs running Windows 10 or later that are enrolled with Intune.
trans-unit.target: This file type is used when you deploy software to PCs running Windows 10 or later that are enrolled with Intune.

trans-unit.source: On the **Summary** page, review the information that you specified.
trans-unit.target: On the **Summary** page, review the information that you specified.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready, choose **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready, choose **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Close** to finish.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Close** to finish.

trans-unit.source: The app is displayed on the **Apps** node of the **Apps** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The app is displayed on the **Apps** node of the **Apps** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Example - Deploying .msi applications to Windows 10 devices
trans-unit.target: Example - Deploying .msi applications to Windows 10 devices

trans-unit.source: In this four-minute video, you'll learn about how to deploy Windows Installer (.msi) applications to enrolled devices that run Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: In this four-minute video, you'll learn about how to deploy Windows Installer (.msi) applications to enrolled devices that run Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After you've created an app, the next step is to deploy it.
trans-unit.target: After you've created an app, the next step is to deploy it.

trans-unit.source: To find out more, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: To find out more, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps.md).
